data.title: Git push doesn't ask for authentication
data.body:

Git push should ask for authentication, but vs-code reports error : 

> Authentication failed on git remote.

data.title: Risky dependency from DebugService to TaskService
data.body:
I have pushed https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/13c79c8c875d3328f0fa6a1431317b42d8a2c99c cos no one knew why there was such _non-standard_ code around. Turns out @outcoldman  is now struck by this. My only reasonable explaining is that `enableTasks` is sometimes [not true](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/index.html#L172)

I see those options
- We always register an instance of an `ITaskService`, the real-one or a dummy
- We check if debug is prepared for not having a task service
- We don't let the instantiation service explode anymore when a dependency is missing

fyi @isidorn @dbaeumer

data.title: IntelliSense should auto-close at the end of the only-suggested-phrase

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
# \- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Fedora 23, 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. For example I'm typing `method`, and IntelliSense suggests that only one phrase.
2. At the end of `method|` (pipe is the caret), IntelliSense doesn't auto-close. If I need to make new line, I have to type <kbd>Enter</kbd> _twice_: one to close IntelliSense, one to make new line.

I think it should auto close in such scenario.

Thanks, and have a nice weekend  `:-)`

data.title: Now, Jade has been renamed to Pug
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
- Open any pug file without syntax highlighting

**Unfortunately**, Jade has been renamed to Pug (ref: https://github.com/pugjs/pug/issues/2184).
We should change `jade` to `pug` on all documents, extensions and supports...

Do you have any plans?

Command should be in English, or add an option to switch that.

data.title: Cursor position bug for text with Mongonlian/Manchu letters
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.0.0 (1.0.0)
- OS Version: OS X Yosemite 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Installing fonts for Mongolian/Manchu texts
   
   You can download free font from here: [Daicing White](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smreg/smreg.github.io/master/css/font/DC_White.ttf)
2. Setting up font config `editor.fontFamily`
3. Input text in Mongolian/Manchu letters, for example:
   `  `
   , the text can be displayed as okay, but the position of the cursor is buggy.
   
   When you input the text naturally from line start, your cursor is at the line end, but it does show at the line head.
   
   Weird when you navigate left forward, and then navigate right forward by the same steps as the left forward part, the cursor would be positioned at the line end and it is okay now. But then you are at the line end again, you press the right arrow key in the keyboard, the cursor would be positioned at the line head again.
# 

Thank the intelligent and hardworking people in Microsoft and the community for bringing out such a "God saw that it was good" text editor, I wish this excellent work could benefit more people.
Thank you. Have a nice day.
(`)__

data.title: add problem matcher for Haxe compiler messages
data.body: As language extensions currently can't contribute problem matchers (and #492 is in the backlog), I thought maybe we could just have a problem matcher for Haxe bundled right in the VS Code. It's simple enough, hence the PR.

data.title: Debugging the same project in multiple instances of Code produces unhandled error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha and 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu 15.10

In most cases users will not hit this issue since it is not possible to open the same folder in multiple instances. But it is reproducible if you open the parent folder in Code and create another launch config.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open 2 instances of Code (either alpha and release or insiders and release) with the same folder
   It is also possible to open the parent of the project folder and point the launch to the same program.
2. Start debugging in one instance.
3. Start debugging the other.

Actual:
Code will hit an unhandled error event
![selection_010](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14576990/21fd6acc-0323-11e6-90fb-9e76e3b71e4c.png)

data.title: Long strings in Debug Console not wrapping
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a long output string to the console
2. Debug

Actual:
![selection_008](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14576811/96aa13ea-0321-11e6-846e-7b7f88edcbc9.png)

![selection_009](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14576813/9c9061ba-0321-11e6-8979-01ccf6c7acc3.png)

They are wrapping correctly in release 1.0.0.

data.title: Add mouse chording support
data.body:
Would be nice to have acme-like mouse chording. Would be even nicer letting the user configure the preferred mouse chord actions.

http://acme.cat-v.org/mouse

data.title: Ruby Language detects Puppet manifest as Ruby
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Fedora 23 x86_64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VSCode
2. Install Puppet Extension
3. Open puppet manifest (.pp file)
4. VSCode detects it as a Ruby file type
##### package.json snippet of offending extension:

``` json
            "id": "ruby",
            "extensions": [ ".rb", ".rbx", ".rjs", ".gemspec", ".pp", ".rake" ],

```

The included Ruby language extension has the puppet extension (.pp) in its extensions list and overrides any installed Puppet extension causing Puppet manifest files to always be detected as Ruby files unless a manual override is put into the User Configuration.

data.title: Shortcut to peek behind parameter hint
data.body:
I find parameter hints useful, but it is frustrating when the hint box obscures the previous lines. 

It would be great to be able to show/hide the hint with a keyboard shortcut, allowing the user to quickly peek behind the box. 

Currently I have to press escape to close the hint, then fumble around with trigger keys to get the hint to show up again.

![tdfqs5ix5n](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1946538/14575111/98441db6-0314-11e6-980f-0376ea7ccdb0.gif)

data.title: Load More Stack Frames strange behavior
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.0.0-alpha Commit 6ea1266160aa9eb3ed6e71a5099bec3952090037
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Compile https://gist.github.com/edumunoz/6e2ca90d4b5d3dbfa5340576e79ac113 with `g++ -g -std=c++11 -pthread hello.cpp -o hello`
2. Install the [C++ debug adapter](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.cpptools)
3. Set a breakpoint in line 17 from the gist
4. Have the main thread expanded in the callstack viewlet
5. Expand another thread and click on a frame for which no source is available
6. The "Load More Stack Frames" button appears for the main thread
7. The "Load More Stack Frames" button is clicked, the callstack for the main thread gets duplicated (two `main()` in the screenshot)

Step 3
![loadmoreframes-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/637952/14575064/49c19a7e-0314-11e6-8863-6b457d261f6e.png)

Step 5
![loadmoreframes-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/637952/14575071/5a5a64f6-0314-11e6-8438-f0e9390a7d53.png)

Step 6
![loadmoreframes-3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/637952/14575076/64f29410-0314-11e6-8a2f-a06df05cb8e2.png)

I understand if the debug adapter implements the "Load More Frames" feature, this will work. However the experience seems kind of weird if the debug adapter doesn't implement the feature (like C++ debug adapter as of now).

@isidorn @weinand

data.title: Copy line up/down key binding not working in Linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 (present in release and latest alpha)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Navigate to a line
2. Press Ctrl+Alt+Shift+UpArrow (or DownArrow)

Actual:
Nothing happens.

data.title: Incorrect TextEditor passed by onDidChangeTextEditorSelection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Two files open inside vscode. 
    -  `index.js` (30 lines: cursor on line 30)
    -  `package.json` (23 lines: cursor on line 10)
2. `package.json` is currently open.
3. Now switch to `index.js` and observe the `onDidChangeTextEditorSelection` event which is fired.

Issue:
In the `TextEditorSelectionChangeEvent` argument, the property `selections` refers to selections in the new document (here `index.js`), while the property `textEditor` points to the old document (here `package.json`).
I guess the `textEditor` should also point to the new file. Also note that, even though `textEditor` points to the old document, `textEditor.selections` has selections of the new doc.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6961317/14574471/8299d9e6-0379-11e6-8689-13b6f1421e9f.png)
